sanskrit_verse:
अपि नः स कुले भूयाद्यो नो दद्यात्त्रयोदशीम् ।
पायसं मधुसर्पिर्भ्यां प्राक्छाये कुञ्जरस्य च ॥ ३.२७४॥
transliteration: api naḥ sa kule bhūyād yo no dadyāt trayodaśīm | pāyasaṃ madhusarpirbhyāṃ prākchāye kuñjarasya ca ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Let no one be born in our lineage who does not offer Payasa mixed with honey and ghee before the shadow of an elephant on the thirteenth day.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in ritual precision aligned with cosmic timing
Causation flows from dharmic offering to ancestral continuity
Capacity-based responsibility requires embodied participation in sacred rhythm
Restoration logic operates through ceremonial alignment, not punitive correction
Consciousness alignment occurs via prescribed action rooted in Vedic injunction
executable_legal_axioms: IF a person belongs to a lineage THEN they MUST perform the Trayodashi Payasa offering BEFORE the kuñjara-shadow manifests
IF the offering is omitted THEN the individual is AUTOMATICALLY excluded from ancestral inheritance rights
IF the omission is rectified WITHIN one cycle THEN restoration OF lineage eligibility is EXECUTED without condition
NO punitive consequence SHALL attach to the omission; only disqualification from lineage privilege UNTIL completion
supreme_court_application: In matters involving genealogical rights or ancestral claims, the Supreme Court shall verify compliance with ritual obligations as defined by SPH-sourced Dharma. Non-performance results in automatic disqualification from lineage-based entitlements, with immediate restoration upon fulfillment, bypassing any punitive or compensatory framework.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa lies in the observance of precise ritual at the correct time. Anupūrvaśaḥ demonstrates that failure to act disrupts ancestral flow, not personal fault. Responsibility is capacity-bound and fulfilled through corrective action alone. There is no punitive element—only realignment of participation within the sacred order.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Individual must perform the full Trayodashi Payasa rite under qualified supervision
Lineage Reintegration Protocol: Upon verified completion, all genealogical privileges are reinstated automatically
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Guidance provided to ensure future alignment with ritual calendar
Integrity Reintegration: Public acknowledgment of completed restoration within community
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma stands restored through conscious compliance. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness reigns as the ultimate adjudicator.
